BaseFrame: The base frame is a element which contains all other elements. The difference to other containers it, is has no parent container.
BasicElement: The basic element is required for all elements to work. All elements inherit from this element.
Button: The button element, with a text in the center.
Checkbox: The checkbox element is a element which can be checked or unchecked.
Container: The container element, this is the parent of all containers (frames, flexboxes, etc.)
Dropdown: The dropdown element can be opened and closed. It contains clickable items.
Flexbox: The flexbox element is a element which can contain other elements. It has a automatic layout system.
Frame: The frame element can contain other elements.
Input: The input element is a element which can be typed in.
Label: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Pyroxenium/Basalt/basalt2/Basalt/Label.lua
The label element, this is a element which can display text.
List: The list element, this is a element which can contain clickable items.
BigMonitor: The big monitor element, this is a element which can contain other elements. Big Monitors are used for big screens (multiple monitors).
Menubar: The menubar element, this is a element which can contain clickable items, menubars scroll horizontally.
Monitor: The monitor element, this is a element which can contain other elements. It is used for single monitors.
MovableFrame: The movable frame element, this is a element which can contain other elements. It can be moved around.
Progressbar: The progressbar element, this is a element which can display progress.
Program: The program element, this element can start a program.
Slider: The slider element, this is a element which can be slided.
Textfield: The textfield element, this is a element which can be typed in.
VisualElement: The visual element, this is the parent of all visual elements, required for visual elements to work.

debug: The debug extension is used for simple debugging.
dynamicValues: The dynamic values extension can create more advanced properties. You put in a string (e.g. parent.width - self.width) and it will create a function based on that string.
templates: The templates extension is used to create more advanced templates. You can also load templates from a JSON file. There are some examples on Github.
xml: The xml extension is used to create elements from XML.
betterBackgrounds: The better backgrounds extension is used to create some more advanced backgrounds.
borders: The borders extension is used to create borders around the elements.
animations: The animations extension is used to create animations. Instead of just reposioning elements, you can animate the position (just an example).
shadows: The shadow extension is used to create shadows for the elements.

downloadFiles.description: Downloads the required files from Github

autoUpdate.description: Automatically checks and downloads new updates on program start

githubRepository.description: The Github repository to download the files from
